company.name: Just Bagels Manufacturing, Inc.
company.address: 340 West 57th Street, Apt. 11J, New York, New York 10019
company.business_description: Just Bagels Manufacturing, Inc. is a wholesale bagel manufacturer that distributes bagels to restaurants, hotels, supermarkets, retail stores, airlines, and schools around the United States.

case_info.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

complaint.factual_background: Just Bagels Manufacturing, Inc., a wholesale bagel manufacturer, published a privacy policy on its website claiming compliance with the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework and U.S.-Swiss Safe Harbor Framework for transferring personal data from Europe and Switzerland to the United States. In truth, the company was not and never had been a participant in either Safe Harbor Framework, making its public claims false and misleading.

representations_made.description: Claimed to be in compliance with the U.S. Department of Commerce Safe Harbor requirements regarding the transfer of personal information from the European Economic Area or Switzerland to the United States
representations_made.quoted_text: Just Bagels Mfg. Inc. is in compliance with the U.S. Department of Commerce Safe Harbor requirements regarding the transfer of personal information from the European Economic Area (“EEA”) or Switzerland to the United States. The principles of Safe Harbor compliance are:

representations_made.description: Represented that it is a current participant in the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework and the U.S.-Swiss Safe Harbor Framework
representations_made.quoted_text: 11. Through the means described in Paragraph 10, respondent has represented, expressly or by implication, that it is a “current” participant in the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework and the U.S.-Swiss Safe Harbor Framework.

counts.title: False Safe Harbor Compliance Claim
counts.representation: Respondent represented that it is a 'current' participant in the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework and the U.S.-Swiss Safe Harbor Framework
counts.fact: Respondent is not and never has been a participant in the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework or the U.S.-Swiss Safe Harbor Framework
counts.conclusion: Therefore, the representations set forth in Paragraph 11 were, and are, false and misleading.

definitions.respondent: Just Bagels Manufacturing, Inc., and its successors and assigns.
definitions.Commerce: as defined in Section 4 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 44.

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Privacy and Security Programs
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent its membership in, adherence to, or participation in any privacy or security program, including the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework and U.S.-Swiss Safe Harbor Framework.

requirements.description: Must not misrepresent the extent to which respondent is a member of, adheres to, complies with, is certified by, is endorsed by, or otherwise participates in any privacy or security program sponsored by the government or any self-regulatory or standard-setting organization
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS ORDERED that respondent and its officers, agents, representatives, and employees, whether acting directly or indirectly, in connection with the advertising, marketing, promotion, offering for sale, or sale of any product or service, in or affecting commerce, shall not misrepresent in any manner, expressly or by implication, the extent to which respondent is a member of, adheres to, complies with, is certified by, is endorsed by, or otherwise participates in any privacy or security program sponsored by the government or any other self-regulatory or standard-setting organization, including, but not limited to, the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework and the U.S.-Swiss Safe Harbor Framework.

provisions.title: Recordkeeping Requirements
provisions.summary: Respondent must maintain and make available to the Commission for inspection all documents relating to compliance with the order for five years.

requirements.description: Maintain and make available to the Commission all documents relating to compliance with this order for a period of five years from the date of preparation or dissemination
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent shall maintain and upon request make available to the Commission for inspection and copying, a print or electronic copy of, for a period of five (5) years from the date of preparation or dissemination, whichever is later, all documents relating to compliance with this order, including but not limited to:

requirements.description: Maintain all advertisements, promotional materials, and statements containing representations covered by this order, with all materials relied upon in disseminating the representation
requirements.quoted_text: A. all advertisements, promotional materials, and any other statements containing any representations covered by this order, with all materials relied upon in disseminating the representation; and

requirements.description: Maintain any documents that call into question respondent's compliance with this order
requirements.quoted_text: B. any documents, whether prepared by or on behalf of respondent, that call into question respondent’s compliance with this order.

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgment and Distribution
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver a copy of this order to all current and future principals, officers, directors, managers, and employees with relevant responsibilities, and obtain signed acknowledgments of receipt.

requirements.description: Deliver a copy of this order to all current and future principals, officers, directors, and managers, and to all current and future employees, agents, and representatives having responsibilities relating to the subject matter of this order
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent shall deliver a copy of this order to all current and future principals, officers, directors, and managers, and to all current and future employees, agents, and representatives having responsibilities relating to the subject matter of this order. Respondent shall deliver this order to such current personnel within thirty (30) days

requirements.description: Deliver this order to current personnel within thirty days after service of this order
requirements.quoted_text: this order. Respondent shall deliver this order to such current personnel within thirty (30) days after service of this order, and to such future personnel within thirty (30) days after the person

requirements.description: Deliver this order to future personnel within thirty days after the person assumes such position or responsibilities
requirements.quoted_text: after service of this order, and to such future personnel within thirty (30) days after the person assumes such position or responsibilities. For any business entity resulting from any change in

requirements.description: For any business entity resulting from any change in structure set forth in Part IV, delivery shall be at least ten days prior to the change in structure
requirements.quoted_text: assumes such position or responsibilities. For any business entity resulting from any change in structure set forth in Part IV, delivery shall be at least ten (10) days prior to the change in structure. Respondent must secure a signed and dated statement acknowledging receipt of this

requirements.description: Secure a signed and dated statement acknowledging receipt of this order, within thirty days of delivery, from all persons receiving a copy of the order
requirements.quoted_text: structure. Respondent must secure a signed and dated statement acknowledging receipt of this order, within thirty (30) days of delivery, from all persons receiving a copy of the order pursuant to this section.

provisions.title: Notification of Corporate Changes
provisions.summary: Respondent must notify the Commission at least thirty days prior to any corporate change that may affect compliance obligations, including dissolution, merger, bankruptcy, or change in corporate name or address.

requirements.description: Notify the Commission at least thirty days prior to any change in the corporation that may affect compliance obligations, including dissolution, assignment, sale, merger, or other action resulting in a successor corporation; creation or dissolution of a subsidiary, parent, or affiliate; proposed filing of a bankruptcy petition; or change in corporate name or address
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent shall notify the Commission at least thirty (30) days prior to any change in the corporation(s) that may affect compliance obligations arising under this order, including, but not limited to: a dissolution, assignment, sale, merger, or other action that would result in the emergence of a successor corporation; the creation or dissolution of a subsidiary, parent, or affiliate that engages in any acts or practices subject to this order; the proposed filing of a bankruptcy petition; or a change in the corporate name or address.

requirements.description: If respondent learns of a proposed change fewer than thirty days prior to the date such action is to take place, notify the Commission as soon as is practicable after obtaining such knowledge
requirements.quoted_text: Provided, however, that, with respect to any proposed change in the corporation(s) about which respondent learns fewer than thirty (30) days prior to the date such action is to take place, respondent shall notify the Commission as soon as is practicable after obtaining such knowledge.

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondent must file a compliance report with the Commission within sixty days after service of this order, and submit additional reports upon request within ten days.

requirements.description: File with the Commission a true and accurate report, in writing, setting forth in detail the manner and form of its compliance with this order
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent, within sixty (60) days after the date of service of this order, shall file with the Commission a true and accurate report, in writing, setting forth in detail the manner and form of its compliance with this order. Within ten (10) days of

requirements.description: Submit an additional true and accurate written report within ten days of receipt of written notice from a representative of the Commission
requirements.quoted_text: forth in detail the manner and form of its compliance with this order. Within ten (10) days of receipt of written notice from a representative of the Commission, it shall submit an additional true and accurate written report.

provisions.title: Order Duration and Termination
provisions.summary: This order will terminate on September 29, 2035, or twenty years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint in federal court alleging any violation of the order, whichever comes later.

requirements.description: Order terminates on September 29, 2035, or twenty years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint in federal court alleging any violation of the order, whichever comes later
requirements.quoted_text: This order will terminate on September 29, 2035, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying consent decree) in federal court alleging any violation of the order, whichever comes later; provided, however, that the filing of such a complaint will not affect the duration of:

duration.termination_text: This order will terminate on September 29, 2035, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying consent decree) in federal court alleging any violation of the order, whichever comes later
